_readme: VC/PE Fund industry playbook for Gunner. Defines the GENERIC framework for any venture capital or private equity fund operation — pipeline stages, roles, scoring, SLAs, drip cadence, and communication defaults. NO tenant-specific IDs, team members, or config. That belongs in the tenant playbook.
name: Venture Capital / Private Equity Fund
description: Raise capital from investors (LPs), deploy into real estate or other deals, manage investor relationships, deal flow, and fund performance.

investor.name: Investor Pipeline
investor.description: Track investor relationships from cold outreach to committed capital.

deal.name: Deal Pipeline
deal.description: Track investment opportunities from sourcing through funding or pass.

capital.name: Capital Pipeline
capital.description: Track fund raises from planning through deployment.

portfolio.name: Portfolio Pipeline
portfolio.description: Track active investments through their lifecycle to exit.

roles.name: Fund Manager
roles.description: CEO/decision maker — owns fund strategy and final investment decisions.

roles.name: Investor Relations
roles.description: Manages LP relationships, communications, and capital raise efforts.

roles.name: Deal Analyst
roles.description: Underwriting, due diligence, and deal evaluation.

roles.name: Operations
roles.description: Back office — capital calls, distributions, reporting, compliance.

scoring.note: Score 0-100. 75+ = HOT (ready to commit). 45-74 = WARM (active nurture). Below 45 = COOL (long-term drip).

communication.note: Email-first, professional tone. Phone for high-value or time-sensitive conversations only.

drip_defaults.note: 12-month nurture cycle with monthly touches. Quarterly reports serve as natural touchpoints (months 3, 6, 9, 12).
